intro: Strobilanthes sanjappae, commonly known as the Sanjappae flame-of-the-forest, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, vibrant orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is typically shrub-like, with lance-shaped leaves and a short, upright growth habit. Its blooming period occurs during the monsoon season, adding a burst of color to the forest understory. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
